title.native: Dr.スランプ・アラレちゃん

description:
Dr. Slump creates a little android girl, Arale, who is very stong, happy, and totally common senseless. They live in Penguin Village where the strangest things happen (e.g., the dawn is announced by a little pig wearing a basquee).

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description: __[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shunsuke_Kikuchi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊池俊輔)__
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/平野靖士)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田誠治_(アニメーション演出家%29)

Seiji Okuda is a veteran anime director. He established Project Team Eikyuukikan, a collaboration of several animators, which was disbanded by him in October 2009. He continues to work freelance, mostly as storyboarder. He is also a member of the JAniCA.

_Note: Not to be confused with the producer [Seiji Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/219343/)._
_Note: Not to be confused with the [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/154403/)._

He is animator and president of animation studio Tomi Production.  He established Tomi Production 1970. It is a small animation studio mostly subcontraction animation, in particular for Shin-Ei Animation. Most work was done on Doraemon tv series and films, for which Tominaga also has been serving as animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1361976813455429637)

Father of [Makoto Koyama](https://anilist.co/staff/146506/).

**[Madhouse Profile](http://www.madhouse.co.jp/special/mhpf/mhpf_no028.html)**

**Inoue Toshiki** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/金春智子)

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/内山正幸)

Passed away due to a heart failure on August 31, 2010.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).
Studio Live animator.

Shibata is a japanese animator and animatior director currently working at Toei Animation. He is the father of the mangaka [Yuusaku Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/107002) and [Hikari Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/127324).

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).
Studio Live animator.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/進藤満尾)

Former representative director of Shindou Production.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡崎稔)

He debuted in 1979 with the story [Wonder Island](https://anilist.co/manga/112596/Wonder-Island/), published in Weekly Shounen Jump, and first gained popularity for the anime and manga series [Dr. Slump](https://anilist.co/manga/30796/Dr-Slump/), originally serialized weekly in Shounen Jump from 1980 to 1984. In 1982, he won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Dr. Slump for best shounen or shoujo manga series of the year.  In 1984, Toriyama was responsible for developing [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/manga/30042/Dragon-Ball/) which was initially serialized in Weekly Shōnen Jump. It became an instant accomplishment—primarily selling over 35,000,000 copies in Japan, Dragon Ball eventually became a record-breaking best seller with over 120,000,000 copies sold. Aside from the Japanese fame, the series was equally successful internationally as well, including in Europe (1988), Canada (1996) and Latin America. Its success encouraged Toriyama to continue working on Dragon Ball from 1984 to 1995. During that eleven-year period, he produced 519 chapters, collected into 42 volumes. Each volume has an average of 200 pages. Moreover, the benefit of the manga led to three anime adaptations, numerous feature-length animated movies, several video games, and mega-merchandising. Toriyama's studio is called "Bird Studio", which is a play on his name, "tori" meaning "bird."

Toriyama married his wife [Yoshimi Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/311142/Nachi-Mikami) on May 2, 1982. She is a former manga artist from Nagoya under the pen name "Nachi Mikami" and occasionally helped Toriyama and his assistant on Dr. Slump when they were short on time. Together with his wife, he had two children: a son born in 1987, and a daughter born in 1990. He was a well-known recluse, who avoided appearing in public or media.

On March 8, 2024, it was announced that Toriyama passed away at the age of 68 from acute subdural hematoma.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/冬杜花代子)
__[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shunsuke_Kikuchi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊池俊輔)__
